name: GitHub (Remote)
description: Interact with GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, actions, and code security through GitHub's hosted remote MCP server. No local installation required. Supports OAuth or Personal Access Token (Bearer) authentication.

inputs.label: GitHub Personal Access Token
inputs.description: Personal Access Token for bearer authentication. Required if your MCP host does not support GitHub OAuth. Create a fine-grained PAT with the scopes needed for the tools you want to use.

obtain.instructions:
1. Go to github.com/settings/tokens
2. Click 'Generate new token' > 'Fine-grained token'
3. Set expiration, select repositories, and choose permissions
4. Click 'Generate token' and copy it

auth.instructions: Primary: OAuth via a pre-registered GitHub OAuth App (VS Code 1.101+, Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf). GitHub does not support DCR. Alternative: Provide a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) as a Bearer token in the Authorization header for hosts that don't support GitHub OAuth.
